intro.description: This cheat sheet will guide you through the steps of preparing the the workbench to start with your support case tutorial.

item.title: Set the @productnameonly@ License
item.description:
To set the @productnameonly@ license:
1. Select Window > Preferences to open the preferences dialog.
2. Select @productnameonly@ .
3. In the License file section browse to the location of your license file.

item.title: Set up Embedded Tomcat in Eclipse
item.description:
To set up embedded Tomcat in your Eclipse workspace:
1. From the Eclipse main menu choose File > New > Other...
2. Click Server > Server.
3. Click Next.
4. Select Tomcat v6.0 Server.
5. Click Finish if you previously configured a Tomcat Server with your Eclipse Workbench.
6. Otherwise select Next.
7. Browse to the folder of your Tomcat installation.
8. Select Finish.

item.title: Create an Eclipse Project with @productnameonly@ Facets
item.description:
1. In the main menu select File > New > Project...
2. In the New Project wizard choose Web > Dynamic Web Project.
3. Click Next.
4. Name your project "Support-Case".
5. In the Configurations entry, select @productnameonly@ Portal in the drop down list.
6. Click Next.
7. Leave the default values for source and build path and select Next.
8. Leave the default values in the Web Module dialog and click Next.
9. In the JSF Capabilities dialog, select Disable Library Configuration for JSF Implementation Library.
10. Click Finish.
Now you see your new dynamic web project in the Navigator or Package Explorer view.

item.title: Setting the Repository Path
item.description:
A dialog opens to inform you to set a location for the repository path.
1. Open the web.xml file residing in the WebContent/WEB-INF folder.
2. The default value of parameter param-home is set to path c:/tmp/jackrabbit.
3. Change this parameter to point to an empty folder or an existing Jackrabbit repository you like to use.

item.title: Create New Model
item.description:
1. Right-click your project in the Package Explorer and select New > Other....
2. Choose @productnameonly@ Wizards > @productnameonly@ Process Model.
3. Click Next.
4. In the upcoming dialog fill in the model name ACME Workflow Model.
5. Select Finish.
